Class LineChartWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.unibas.bsc.detapp.utilities.LineChartWrapper

  • public class LineChartWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class for managing LineCharts.

      • LineChartWrapper

        public LineChartWrapper(com.github.mikephil.charting.charts.LineChart lineChart,
                        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> counterList,
                        java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> sensorPosition)
        Use this constructor when initializing a LineChart where each dataset has a different . The data points start at .
        Parameters:
        lineChart - LineChart object
        counterList - List of counters. For each counter, a new LineDataSet is created and colored
        sensorPosition - Position of the sensor as string which is shown on the top right corner

    • Method Detail

      • notifyLiveDataChanged

        public void notifyLiveDataChanged()
        Refresh chart by notifying it about data changes first, then setting adaptively the Y Axis to show the maximum and minimum Y values. Reset the visible XRange and move the view on the X axis to show only the latest VISIBLE_X_RANGE values. This gives the impression of a "moving" line chart axis.

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(int dataset,
                     int position,
                     java.lang.Long measurement)
        Adds a data point to the chart.
        Parameters:
        dataset - Dataset where the data point is added.
        position - The position (X-Axis) from the data point.
        measurement - The corresponding value to the position.

      • shiftRecording

        public void shiftRecording(int dataset,
                           int shift)
        Shits all entries in a dataset by a given amount.
        Parameters:
        dataset - Index of dataset
        shift - Amount to shift
